tool.name: GEMINI @BINARY@

macros.token: Caveat: due to a bug in this version of GEMINI, filtering on alternate allele frequency will get disabled when you select 'All non-synonymous variants' as the types of variants to be used for the burden calculations above.

tool.command: gemini @BINARY@ $nonsynonymous #if str($analysis.mode) == "c-alpha": --calpha #if str($analysis.casecontrol.source) == "custom": --cases #echo (" ".join("'" + token + "'" for token in $analysis.casecontrol.cases.strip().split()))# --controls #echo (" ".join("'" + token + "'" for token in $analysis.casecontrol.controls.strip().split()))# #end if --min-aaf ${analysis.min_aaf} --max-aaf ${analysis.max_aaf} --permutations ${analysis.permutations} ${analysis.save_tscores} #end if '$infile' > '$outfile' #if str($analysis.mode) == "c-alpha" and $analysis.save_tscores: && touch permutated_t_scores.txt && mv permutated_t_scores.txt $t_scores #end if

param.name: nonsynonymous
param.label: Use the following types of variants for the burden calculation

param.name: mode
param.label: Which type of burden calculation should be performed?
param.option: Count of variants per gene and sample

param.name: source
param.label: Selection of case and control samples
param.help: Specify how case and control samples for the C-alpha association test should be selected

param.name: cases
param.label: Space separated list of cases for association testing

param.name: controls
param.label: Space separated list of controls for association testing

param.name: min_aaf
param.label: The min. alt. allele frequency for a variant to be included

param.name: max_aaf
param.label: The max. alt. allele frequency for a variant to be included

param.name: permutations
param.label: Number of permutations to run for the C-alpha test

param.name: save_tscores
param.label: Save the list of individual T-scores from all permutations as an extra dataset

data.name: t_scores
data.label: GEMINI burden permuted T scores on ${on_string}

tool.help:
**What it does**
Burden performs sample-wise gene-level burden calculations.
The burden tool provides a set of utilities to perform burden summaries on a per-gene, per sample basis. By default, it outputs a table of gene-wise counts of all high impact variants in coding regions for each sample:
GEMINI burden example::
gene M10475 M10478 M10500 M128215 WDR37 2 2 2 2 CTBP2 0 0 0 1 DHODH 1 0 0 0
**Setting examples**
**--nonsynonymous**
If you want to be a little bit less restrictive, you can include all non-synonymous variants instead.
GEMINI output with setting --nonsynonymous::
gene M10475 M10478 M10500 M128215 SYCE1 0 1 1 0 WDR37 2 2 2 2 CTBP2 0 0 0 1 ASAH2C 2 1 1 0 DHODH 1 0 0 0
**--calpha**
If your database has been loaded with a PED file describing case and control samples, you can calculate the c-alpha statistic for cases vs. control.
GEMINI output with setting --calpha::
gene T c Z p_value SYCE1 -0.5 0.25 -1.0 0.841344746069 WDR37 -1.0 1.5 -0.816496580928 0.792891910879 CTBP2 0.0 0.0 nan nan ASAH2C -0.5 0.75 -0.57735026919 0.718148569175 DHODH 0.0 0.0 nan nan
To calculate the **P-value** using a permutation test, use the --permutations option, specifying the number of permutations of the case/control labels you want to use.
**--min-aaf and --max-aaf for --calpha**
By default, all variants affecting a given gene will be included in the C-alpha computation. However, one may establish alternate allele frequency boundaries for the variants included using the --min-aaf and --max-aaf options.
Used settings:
- -calpha test.burden.db - -min-aaf 0.0 - -max-aaf 0.01 - -cases - -controls for --calpha
If you do not have a PED file loaded, or your PED file does not follow the standard PED phenotype encoding format you can still perform the c-alpha test, but you have to specify which samples are the control samples and which are the case samples.
Used settings:
- -controls M10475 M10478 - -cases M10500 M128215 - -calpha
Output::
gene T c Z p_value SYCE1 -0.5 0.25 -1.0 0.841344746069 WDR37 -1.0 1.5 -0.816496580928 0.792891910879 CTBP2 0.0 0.0 nan nan ASAH2C -0.5 0.75 -0.57735026919 0.718148569175 DHODH 0.0 0.0 nan nan
**--nonsynonymous --calpha**
If you would rather consider all nonsynonymous variants for the C-alpha test rather than just the medium and high impact variants, add the --nonsynonymous flag.
